FuncDef: The reset mpls-tp oam meg statistic-type command clears MPLS-TP OAM performance statistics.
CLIs: reset mpls-tp oam meg <meg-name> statistic-type { lost-measure { single-ended | dual-ended } | delay-measure { one-way | two-way } }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a MEG.
The value is a string of 1 to 14 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Clears statistics about frame loss measurement.
-

Clears statistics about single-ended frame loss measurement.
-

Clears statistics about dual-ended frame loss measurement.
-

Clears statistics about frame delay measurement.
-

Clears statistics about one-way frame delay measurement.
-

Clears statistics about two-way frame delay measurement.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset mpls-tp oam meg test statistic-type delay-measure one-way
<HUAWEI> reset mpls-tp oam meg test statistic-type lost-measure dual-ended
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
MPLS-TP OAM performance monitoring is classified into the following types:
Proactive monitoring: periodically monitors connectivity in a MEG. It detects faults that occur during dual-ended frame LM or one-way frame DM. To view proactive monitoring results, run the display mpls-tp oam meg statistic-type. To clear statistics, run the reset mpls-tp oam meg statistic-type command.On-demand monitoring: monitors connectivity of a MEG at a time. It detects faults that occur during single-ended frame LM or two-way frame DM. On-demand monitoring results are automatically displayed in real time. Statistics will not be saved in the system and therefore the reset mpls-tp oam statistic-type command does not need to be used to clear the statistics.
Run the reset mpls-tp oam meg statistic-type lost-measure command with either of the following parameters to clear frame loss statistics:
single-ended: clears single-ended frame loss statistics.dual-ended: clears dual-ended frame loss statistics.
Run the reset mpls-tp oam meg statistic-type delay-measure command with either of the following parameters to clear frame delay statistics:
one-way: clears one-way frame delay statistics.two-way: clears two-way frame delay statistics.

Prerequisites
The ME of the MEG has been bound to a tunnel.
Configuration Impact
The reset mpls-tp oam meg statistic-type command clears statistics about a specified MEG.
Precautions
If proactive performance statistics are being collected, the reset mpls-tp oam statistic-type command cannot be run.
